flawed_nl_solution:
On 80 games, Daniel spend 80 games * $12/game = $<<80*12=960>>960.
The rest of the collection is 346 games - 80 games = <<346-80=626>>626 games.
50% of these games means 50/100 * 626 games = <<50/100*626=313>>313 games.
Daniel bought them for $7 each, so he had to spend 313 games * $7/game = $<<313*7=2191>>2191 on them.
The other 313 games were bought for $3 each, so they've cost him 313 games * $3/game = $<<313*3=939>>939.
On all games in total Daniel spent $960 + $2191 + $939 = $<<960+2191+939=4090>>4090.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 266, not 626. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
